alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jessamine (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 12:52PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL CLARK...NORTHEASTERN JESSAMINE...SOUTHWESTERN BOURBON AND FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 130 PM EDT... At 1252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cardinal Hill, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Winchester, Paris, Meadowthorpe, Dunbar High School, Thoroughbred Acres, Cardinal Hill, Cadentown, Northland and Highlands. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central Kentucky.
